1E21967A2B914A53B729684E7A3430E0.description: Explore tools of measurement and demonstrate accurate measurement of: dry and liquid ingredients; Metric vs. Imperial measurement; weight, mass and volume; temperature; sifted vs. unsifted flour; and, ways to measure solid fat;.

A993CE07B2E24850AF53450881E41BFC.description: Examine criteria and standards (e.g., heat conductivity, sturdy handles, heavy-gauge materials) of quality cookware and kitchen tools.

5BF12C0F11CF4F94AB70E94F345E6E75.description: Identify common kitchen tools and equipment.

9AD37D27DE984003ACE51D48C01C14A4.description: Explore the use of common kitchen tools and equipment.

BA1BAD422D274A4EA685D5B8183EF854.description: Plan, prepare and serve food items using a recipe.

DE6589155C464DDCA27A1BAA9AE18E89.description: Examine the information (e.g., ingredients, quantities, cooking time) provided in a recipe

198D507C6E3146A9836B72616361C4A8.description: Complete recipes according to specified criteria, including timelines, to produce a quality product.

1A8BEF8510324792A024640395A65D86.description: Convert measurements (e.g., weight versus volume, changing the yield of a recipe) accurately in food preparation tasks

0105D4DFE778417ABFF02C4E70687F7A.description: Demonstrate correct dry and liquid measuring techniques with metric and imperial measurement units.

CFF7589BE2C6429AA521E38B05100819.description: Explore reasons (e.g., cost, ingredient availability, nutrition) to modify or adapt recipes.

19F9FAD716C942829E917942603C1C27.description: Adapt recipes for adjustments, corrections and substitutions in ingredients, equipment and methods in order to achieve similar results.

A3925EF714E3400E8A9FD1734BCF2329.description: Distinguish between ingredients that are required in a recipe from those that are optional.

4E682CE31A7743519D6942AA03CD41D5.description: Demonstrate the ability to follow a recipe accurately (e.g., proper measuring techniques, following step by step, using equipment properly).

A6CE94D08F614D5390F3C21199042B29.description: Identify components of recipe development and modification, including ingredients and their functions, proportions, temperatures and preparation methods

89B5C11338E445F0B861FB83DBE56A66.description: Discuss food preparation vocabulary and equipment used in a recipe.

79BF5331309045A084660529AE0124FD.description: Evaluate recipes from a variety of sources to select recipes according to set criteria.

60D4A7DE3BEE4CC28236E908D78F8E84.description: Produce a quality food product by accurately using a recipe.

1EB25ECE605346C2B5FD79E1032BDFC8.description: Demonstrate how to prepare recipes using proper food safe practices (e.g., frequent hand washing, avoiding food cross-contamination, washing produce, cooking to proper food temperatures).

78FA6AC001A349B1A897ADD0BB67B0FA.description: Examine safe and responsible recycling and disposal of kitchen waste.

0B54850C2372452D98C036992BC55B7C.description: Demonstrate how to safely dispose of used oils.

CDB99C15ADBC46A98FCCAB02CCAD5F38.description: Research and compare the three categories of contamination: biological (e.g., bacteria or viruses); physical (e.g., objects that enter any stage of food preparation); and, chemical (e.g., cleaning products and naturally occurring).

F38A3C24795A4CF78B0747FD218169FA.description: Determine the causes and preventions of the following food borne illnesses: Norovirus; Salmonella; Clostridium perfringens; Campylobacter; and, Staphylococcus aureus (Staph).

EE48E514DF6E42568D82D2D48AC69CE5.description: Analyze the conditions (e.g., temperature, time, acidity [pH], moisture, a food source, poor personal hygiene and poor sanitation) necessary for a food borne illness to survive.

ABC690295839459DB8943F07A3BE6D8C.description: Discuss the two types of contamination (i.e., direct and indirect/cross contamination).

421DA0BA2F7E4FA3888E79328EEA47B7.description: Determine safe food temperature zones for various foods (e.g., poultry, egg dishes, pork, beef).

525D530AB4B043AE802A6B825764BD57.description: Explore aspects of food contamination such as how it occurs and how to identify spoiled food.

1CB64CCA96384115BFBD43E0C4FC850C.description: Research best practices (e.g., proper food storage, wearing and changing gloves, using separate equipment) involved in mitigating the risk of cross-contamination for individuals with severe food allergies.

CFE025D74C2D4671AA88E7E013032FC1.description: Discuss the importance of safe thawing practices using various methods (i.e., cool running water, microwave, refrigerator).

D09FF1C505244715AD41AF430C1CF36A.description: Explain the importance of proper food storage (e.g., dried, frozen, refrigerated, food-safe containers) in safe food handling.

9AAA54A7BB5C4E2DB9575E364F3380D7.description: Investigate common symptoms (e.g., vomiting, diarrhea, cramps, bloating) of food poisoning.

519F9F15B0E1463EB2CB7756B29E0B1E.description: Discuss causes of food borne illnesses.

0F1E7BD1D1004911898638B134BAA106.description: Examine the importance of personal hygiene and using personal protective equipment (e.g., gloves) for food safety.

56A0F151873C4099BCD2A8E9E34DC98C.description: Examine the importance of safe food handling, preparation and storage.

FF6D1C3C1BBF4CA99B4E2131DF0CB852.description: Safe Food Handling A, B, C (Core)

B5FA07323AFC4CBC8A4360E1F56C6C63.description: Demonstrate safe work practices in the kitchen to prevent accidents (e.g., cuts, slips, falls and burns).

DA2FFCB9648543088FDC081586D058BC.description: Discuss the principles of basic first aid (e.g., treatment of burns and scalds, bleeding, poisoning, eye injuries and choking).

DCCC11F282CE4804A272C5D10F7DDD94.description: Explore fire prevention and control strategies for kitchen areas.

958B0F2CF6FA4E9F8849E2CBB573A8EA.description: Apply relevant food safety standards when preparing, cooking and serving food.

1C0CB2D06221473DB1108BCF99B2D530.description: Demonstrate safe and hygienic food and cooking preparation techniques using current and advanced technologies to produce a quality product.

6279BE0D08E6403485992862AAE53676.description: Identify hazards and safety practices outlined in manufacturer’s operator’s manual for large and small appliances (e.g., mixers, food processors, stoves) used during food preparation.

8054D0A5D9E84B0BA57C0F515CC5822C.description: Practise sanitation procedures and sanitary preparation of spaces, tools and equipment when preparing food including: hand washing dishes, bakeware, utensils; proper hand washing techniques; laundering kitchen towels, oven mitts, aprons; and, loading the dishwasher.

EA699C50388545739B99017C8EF17BB8.description: Demonstrate safety procedures (e.g., knife safety, proper use of equipment) as they apply to food preparation.

0690B328A8D849C4A42A7BE2DFB8EEA3.description: Discuss the importance of focusing on personal tasks while maintaining an awareness of others working in proximity.

14779959AF0047F4A1F0961F9BB01BC1.description: Integrate safety practices into food preparation.
